title: Theme Food and drink - tto123
description: Dit thema valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollectie voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1,2 en 3. Dit is thema 8 'Food and drink'. Het thema omvat de volgende onderwerpen: Eating and preparing food, Meals and drinks, Healthy food en Fast food. Binnen de grammatica wordt in dit thema ‘simple present’, ‘present continuous’, 'voltooid deelwoord' en 'bezittelijk voornaamwoord' behandeld.

items.content:
Welcome to the eighth theme of English
This theme is about Food and drink.

How?
You are going to practise your listening, reading, speaking and writing skills.
You will visit websites, play games, do exercises and listen to stories.

What?
You are going to read, listen, speak and write about food and drink.
By practising a lot your English will improve!

Have fun!

You have just started the theme Food and drink.
You will find different things to watch, to listen to, to read and of course to do.
There are videos, recordings, pictures, photos, texts and assignments.
There are different types of assignments. Some of them you have to do on your own, others you are doing in a group.

At the end of those group assignments you are going to discuss the answers in your group. Some assignment will be checked by the computer.

Look at the picture of fruits and vegetables below.
Write down the English name for the fruits and vegetables you know.


Look at the wordlist below to check how many English names you guessed correctly.

When you open the list and click on the red arrow, you can also choose to practice with a pronounciation.
Write down five words that you didn't know yet in your notebook.

Vocabularylist Fruit and vegetables

In this theme you will focus on the following 'can do' statements.

Listening

  • (when people talk slowly and clearly) you can understand words and basic sentences that have something to do with food and drink.

Reading

  • You can understand words and basic sentences in a simple story about food and drink.

Having a conversation

  • You can join a simple conversation when the conversational partner is willing to speak slowly, repeats the sentences, formulates the words and helps you formulate what you're trying to say.
  • You can ask and answer simple questions that have something to do with the theme food and drink.
    For example in a conversation about your favourite food.

Speaking

  • you can use simple phrases and sentences about the theme food and drink.

Writing

  • You can write a short, simple story or an e-mail that has something to do with the theme food and drink.

In this theme you are going to do the following things:

  • Listen to people talking about meals and their favourite foods.
  • Read texts about food in different countries and about how to prepare food.
  • Having a conversation about fast food.
  • Make a menu.

But you don't have to be able to do this right away!
If you take the following steps (lessons) you'll find out what you need to know!

Lesson

Title

Activity

1

Eating and preparing food

Listen, read, write and speak about eating and preparing food and visiting a restaurant.

Grammar: practise present simple and present continuous.

2

Meals and drinks

Listen, read, write and speak about meals and drinks.

Grammar: past prarticiple.

3

Healthy food

Listen, read, write and speak about fruit, preparing food and barbecue.

Grammar: present perfect.

4

Fast food

Listen, read, write an essay and speak about preparing fried chicken and other fast food.

Grammar: possessive pronouns.

Below are the four lessons that belong to this topic.
Make your choice.

Lesson 1

Eating and preparing food
Lesson 2

Meals and drinks
Lesson 3

Healthy food
Lesson 4

Fast food

Vocabulary Food and drink

Here you can find the vocabulary lists with sentences (chunks) that accompany this theme.
These lists will also be used in the diagnostic test. Talk to your teacher about when you will learn these lists.

Vocabularylist Food and drink A Food and drink chunks A
Vocabularylist Food and drink B Food and drink chunks B
Vocabularylist Food and drink C

Tip:

There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them.
Click in StudioWozzol on the red arrow for the options.

You've finished the lessons for the theme Food and drink.
Now it is time for the Finishing touch.
Here you will find an extra assignment.
Work together with a classmate.
When you are finished you will make the diagnostic test and fill in the evaluation.

Good luck!

Is it easy to eat out in your town or city? Do you miss a certain kind of bar or restaurant?
In this task you get the chance to think about setting up your own!

  • Work in groups of four.
  • Think of a good location in your town or city for setting up a restaurant.
    Think of reasons to support your idea as well!
  • Think of a concept for your bar/restaurant (fast food? healthy food? sandwiches? ethnic food?). Think of something you all like!
  • Design the menu for your restaurant. You should include four categories,
    one of them being drinks and the other three being food (e.g. starter, main course, dessert, sandwiches, breakfast etc.).
    Each category should have at least three options (dishes).
  • Make a presentation about why your new restaurant is a great idea.
    Together with your class vote for the best idea!

Very important:
Money is not a problem! Think of whatever you like.
Don't forget to use your fantasy!
Test your knowledge. Make the diagnostic test.

content.body:
In the sentences below, choose the correct form of the verb.

  1. Every day Sarah (go) is going / goes to school by bus but now she is cycling to school.
  2. I (drink) drink / am drinking a lot of cola, but now I (drink) drink / am drinking a pint of beer.
  3. Usually he watches a video at home but now he (watch) watches / is watching a film in the cinema.

Fill in the correct form of the Past Simple and Past particle.

Verb

Past Simple

Past particple

to live

to cry

to break

to choose

to do

to write

to have

In the sentences below, has the Present perfect tense been used correctly?
Choose correct or wrong.

  1. We have lived here for six years. correct / wrong
  2. He has already payed for it. correct / wrong
  3. Has he left you? correct / wrong

Fill in the correct possessive pronoun in the following sentences.

  1. That isn't my / mine book.
  2. Are these old shoes yours / your?
  3. Everybody must keep theirs / their passports ready.

prompt.body:
You are going to read a story about Anti-ageing chocolate.
After reading the story, answer the question below.

Imagine chocolate that keeps you younger looking!

It is too good to be true, but scientists working with Cambridge University have invented an anti-ageing chocolate.

It keeps away wrinkles and helps the skin look younger.

The chocolate's name is 'Esthechoc': a combination of the words 'esthetic' (meaning all things beautiful) and 'chocolate'. It is also called Cambridge Beauty Chocolate.

The lab hopes young, rich business executives will buy it.

The chocolate contains a special chemical that gives flamingos their pink colour.

Scientists say the chemical can make the skin of a 50 to 60-year-old person look like a 20 to 30-year-old.

Other scientists say more research is needed for people to know whether or not Esthechoc works…..!

  1. Give two reasons why eating anti-ageing chocolate would be good for you.
  2. What's the name of this chocolate (2 options)?
  3. What do you think, is it a natural product?

values.value:
1. It keeps away wrinkles.
    It helps the skin look younger.
  2. Esthechoc
    Cambridge Beauty Chocolate

  3. I don’t think so, it contains something chemical.

content.body:
1. It keeps away wrinkles.
    It helps the skin look younger.
  2. Esthechoc
    Cambridge Beauty Chocolate

  3. I don't think so, it contains something chemical.

prompt.body:
You are going to make an Easy Chicken Pizza on your own.
You will find the recipe below. First you have to make a shopping list of the necessary ingredients.

Easy Chicken Pizza

Ingredients

  • 1 small onion, chopped (= fijngehakt)
  • ½ red bell pepper, chopped
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ¼ teaspoon pepper
  • 1 teaspoon olive oil
  • 1 (10-ounce) can refrigerated pizza crust (= blikje koele pizzabodem)
  • ½ cup Hickory smoke barbecue sauce
  • 2 (6-ounce) packages grilled boneless, skinless (= zonder botten en vel) chicken breast strips
  • 2 cups (8 ounces) shredded (= gesnipperd) Monterey Jack cheese with peppers
  • Garnish (= Garnering):
    Chopped fresh parsley (= peterselie)
    Hickory smoke barbecue sauce


Make a shoppinglist.

values.value:
Shopping list:

  • onion
  • red pepper
  • salt
  • pepper
  • olive oil
  • pizza crust (1 can, 10 ounce)
  • Hickory smoke barbecue sauce
  • chicken breast (2 packages/ 6 ounce)
  • shredded Monterey Jack cheese with peppers (2 cups, 8 ounces)
  • fresh parsley

prompt.body:
Read the text below and answer the question:

PUBS

The word pub is short for public house.

There are over 60,000 pubs in the UK (53,000 in England and Wales, 5,200 in Scotland and 1,600 in Northern Ireland). One of the oldest pubs, Fighting Cocks in St. Albans, Herts, is located in a building that dates back to the eleventh century.

Pubs are popular social meeting places
Pubs are an important part of British life. People talk, eat, drink, meet their friends and relax there. Pubs often have two bars, one usually quieter than the other.

Many pubs have a garden where people can sit in the summer.

Children can go in pub gardens with their parents.

Groups of friends normally buy 'rounds' of drinks, where the person whose turn it is will buy drinks for all the members of the group.

If you spill (= morsen) a stranger's drink by accident, it is good manners to offer to buy another drink.

Pubs sell soft drinks as well as alcohol
Although most people think pubs are places where people drink alcohol, pubs in fact sell soft drinks (non alcoholic) too.

British people drink an average of 99.4 litres of beer every year.

More than 80% of this beer is drunk in pubs and clubs.


Can you mention - at least - four beer brands?
(Dutch, English or international)

values.value:
Example answer:

Grolsch, Carlsberg, Duvel, Corona, Heineken, Leffe, Guiness, Bavaria, Hertog Jan, Schultenbrau

content.body:
Example answer:

Grolsch, Carlsberg, Duvel, Corona, Heineken, Leffe, Guiness, Bavaria, Hertog Jan, Schultenbrau

prompt.body:
Read the text below and answer the questions.

Children's bad teeth

A dentist in the UK had to take out all of the baby teeth from a two-year-old child because the teeth were rotten. Unfortunately, that child is not the only one with such problems.

It is a whole generation of children in the UK. In one year, dentists had to remove teeth from as many as 14,000 children aged 5 and under. This cost the National Health Service a lot of money and removing baby teeth leads to more problems later in a child's life.

The reason for the children's rotten teeth is unhealthy food. The children are eating too much processed food and drinking fizzy drinks with a lot of sugar in them.

Doctors say that the parents need more information, so they know not what to give their children.

  1. Why did the dentist have to take out all of the teeth from the child?
  2. How old was the child who's teeth had to be removed?
  3. What is the consequence for children when their teeth have been removed at a young age?
  4. What is the reason for the children's rotten teeth?

  5. What has to be done, according to doctors, to prevent children from eating bad food.

values.value:
1. The teeth were rotten
  2. 2 years old
  3. It leads to more problems later in a child’s life.
  4. Unhealthy food
  5. Parents should get more information, so they know not what to give their child.

content.body:
1. The teeth were rotten
  2. 2 years old
  3. It leads to more problems later in a child's life.
  4. Unhealthy food
  5. Parents should get more information, so they know not what to give their child.

items.content:
Can do statements

Take a look at the Can do statements in the introduction - 'Can do'.

  • Are you able to do what you have to do?
  • Which assignment was the best one to learn from?

Analyse your mistakes

What did you learn of the mistakes you made in this theme?
You can learn a lot of your mistakes! What mistakes did you make?

  • I did not learn enough
  • I did not understand the grammar.
  • I made sloppy mistakes.
  • I lost concentration.
  • I used the wrong words, I had to check my vocabulary.

Group work

  • What do you think of working in a group?
  • Did every group member do the same amount of work?

Projects

  • Which project(s) did you choose? Why?
  • What did you think of the project?
